question.title: In which scenario the UsersRequestBuilder.get() from Microsoft Graph SDK will return null?
question.body:
I am using the com.microsoft.graph.serviceclient.GraphServiceClient class to retrieve users:

UserCollectionResponse userCollectionResponse = graphClient.users().get(conf -> {
                conf.queryParameters.filter = "mail eq '" + email + "'"; 
  });
List<User> users = userCollectionResponse.getValue(); // potential NPE

When I see the signature of the UsersRequestBuilder::get() method, I see it is marked as @Nullable

 @Nullable
 public UserCollectionResponse get(final Consumer<GetRequestConfiguration> requestConfiguration)

I am not sure if to make a null check before calling getValue() since I am not able to find a scenario where this userCollectionResponse is null. If I look for users with email that do not exist I simply get empty list of users.

In which scenario the UsersRequestBuilder.get() method might return null? Is there a way to simulate this scenario?

answers.body:
I think that the SDK is generated by Kiota tool from the OpenAPI specification for the GraphAPI. If the OpenAPI specification does not explicitly specify that the response object is required, Kiota will generate it as nullable.

Anyway, you're right, the Graph api will return an empty array in the worst case.
